intro: Litsea fulva var. fulva, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by bright orange to red drupes that are attractive to birds. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in moist, well-drained environments. The species is noted for its rapid growth and has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive.
